Take the #GoGreenPledge

April is Earth Month and the City of Long Beach is asking residents to take the #GoGreenPledge to help protect the environment. Choose just one, or commit to all six pledges for one month and win prizes!

Discover Your Long Beach

Receive the latest information on news, events and more by signing up to City's official newsletter!

New Blue Improvements Projects

New Blue Line improvements will begin on January 26, 2019, so let us help you plan ahead.

Long Beach Public Library Launches A Newly Designed Website

Visit the new and user-friendly LBPL website where members can easily find free digital resources, library events and more!

Volunteers Make A Tradition Out Of Helping People Experiencing Homelessness

These individuals learn first-hand about the lives of those that society often attempts to ignore by getting involved in helping solve homelessness in their community.

City News Releases

Special Events: This Week

All Special Events

Meetings & Notices

  • 4/21/2019

    Farmers Marketplace Of Long Beach
    Check out the premier farmers market serving the 5th District!

  • 4/23/2019

    Baby & Lap-Sit Storytime

    Join us for joyful songs, playful exercises, and fun books. Suitable for ages 0-9 months. Please knock on the glass doors and someone will let you in.

  • 4/23/2019

    Dance For Life

    Get yourself moving to American Pop music and Cambodian music!

  • 4/23/2019

    Tai Chi Classes with the Heart of Ida

    Join us for Tai Chi classes for better balance and fall prevention. Please wear comfortable clothing and invite a friend!

  • 4/23/2019

    Teen Focus

    Teen Focus engages teens and tweens ages 10-17 in STEM related activities while having fun.

  • 4/23/2019

    After School Club: Craft Cinema
    Watch your favorite family movies while creating your own make and take craft! Materials provided.

  • 4/23/2019

    After School Storytime

    Come in and enjoy fun stories and activities in our Story Corner. Suitable for ages 6 and up.
